text: Sorry but nobody answers, here? I can read a lot of questions and no answers at all.
You need to create a developer account I believe that will give you full access <https://developers.HubSpot.com/>
Hi Erica it is always best to try and post your questions in a couple relevant channels since some are more monitored than others.
From what I understand dnd areas can't have ids or classes directly. If you want to add it directly to the template then maybe try wrapping it with a module attribute.
then wrap it with a div and your id. ***I'm just taking a guess here but this is something I would look to do it I needed an id.

We’re looking to reduce the number of channels to make it easier to find the relevant channel. (no ETA on when we’ll do that, just something we’re thinking about)

Additionally this is a community, if you help others, others will happily help you. For context this slack community has grown rapidly over the last few years from around 500 developers to as you can see over 10,000 in this channel alone.

That means there are tons of people here who are new. Many may not have yet experienced what happens when you pay it forward yet. This community is pretty awesome when you engage with it.
